name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one has a melting point that we can compare to the melting point of 2-phenyl-1,3-oxazole, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group (–OCH3) in place of a hydrogen atom increases the molecular weight and size which generally raises the melting point. The benzylidene group (C(=C)C) adds rigidity and molecular weight, contributing approximately +20. The methoxy group also introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10. The oxazole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20. The presence of two phenyl groups can also increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
